inspirationalQuote.text: The good physician treats the disease; the great physician treats the patient who has the disease.
inspirationalQuote.author: William Osler

paretoBanner.title: Pareto Principle in Medicine
paretoBanner.description: Focus on the 20% of topics that appear most frequently in exams, as they will likely account for 80% of your score.

questionOfTheDay.question: Which of the following is the most common cause of community-acquired pneumonia?

subjects.name: Anatomy
subjects.description: The study of the structure of the human body, from macroscopic to microscopic levels.

subjects.name: Physiology
subjects.description: The science of how the human body functions in health and disease.

subjects.name: Biochemistry
subjects.description: The study of chemical processes within and relating to living organisms.

subjects.name: Pathology
subjects.description: The study of the causes and effects of disease or injury.

subjects.name: Microbiology
subjects.description: The study of microscopic organisms, such as bacteria, viruses, archaea, fungi and protozoa.

subjects.name: Pharmacology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine concerned with the uses, effects, and modes of action of drugs.

textbooks.title: Goodman & Gilman's: The Pharmacological Basis of Therapeutics
textbooks.author: Laurence Brunton

subjects.name: Community Medicine
subjects.description: A branch of medicine that is concerned with the health of the members of a community, municipality, or region.

subjects.name: Forensic Medicine
subjects.description: The application of medical knowledge to the investigation of crime, particularly in establishing the causes of injury or death.

subjects.name: ENT
subjects.description: The branch of medicine and surgery specializing in the diagnosis and treatment of disorders of the head and neck.

subjects.name: Ophthalmology
subjects.description: The branch of medicine concerned with the study and treatment of disorders and diseases of the eye.

subjects.name: General Medicine
subjects.description: Includes Psychiatry & Dermatology. The medical specialty dealing with the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of adult diseases.

subjects.name: General Surgery
subjects.description: Includes Orthopaedics, Radiology & Anesthesiology. A surgical specialty that focuses on abdominal contents.

subjects.name: Obstetrics & Gynaecology (OBG)
subjects.description: The two surgical-medical specialties dealing with the female reproductive organs in their pregnant and non-pregnant state, respectively.

subjects.name: Pediatrics
subjects.description: The branch of medicine involving the medical care of infants, children, and adolescents.
